Author: howunfortunate_
Text: i'm not trans but i relate a lot because recently i was put on antidepressants that made me lose a lot of appetite. probably my best tip would to avoid the scale at all costs (seeing my low weight "encourages me", in a way ://). maybe set alarms for meal times/snacks to make sure you're eating enough. i force myself to eat 3 times a day, even if they're all small meals, just to avoid slipping back in my old habits. eating enough might help prevent bp cycles too, but that depends from person to person   that said, one of my best friends is FtM and losing body fat after going on T is pretty normal (as men have a lower bf% compared to women), if that gives you a bit of comfort. it's unlikely to go away if you keep up HRT, so there's no need to further restrict yourself. be kind to yourself! transition is super hard as it is
